content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like it and it is well defined. I coded own working solution
I think it's good idea to make it Reverse Mode with more examples. It will be nice puzzle to find solution. Well done!

Instead of "Cannot win with one move" an invalid coordinate like -1 -1 would seem more tricky I suppose which will be relevant for Reverse Coding since sentences are not preferrable as output in Reverse mode.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: great work

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Now that corrections have been made, everything looks fine to me.
Clear and fun clash!

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: it seems to me that he made great efforts to make this clash 
good luck

Missing test cases ...
- There are no test cases for column checks
- There are no test cases for top-right to bottom-left diagonal checks

Stub default ouput (not really an issue) ...
- Default output is "true" ???

Just some thoughts for extra difficulty ... 
- Usually, in tic tac toe, the starting player is X hence whose turn it is could be determined just by looking at the board instead of getting it as input (e.g.: Two Xs and two Os means it's X turn)
- You could add invalid boards as input which would result to "Invalid board." output (e.g.: Four Xs and two Os would be invalid)

Binary output issue
* As per contribution guidelines, binary output should be avoided for clashes. Since there are only two possible answers in total (true / false), this contribution suffers from the binary output issue. Please revise the output requirement so that there are more than 2 possible answers in total.

Goal
* Please remove all the quotation marks.

Input
* Please format "X", "O" and "." as {{constants}}.

* Please remove all the quotation marks.

Output
* Please remove all the quotation marks.

Constraints
* Please delete the second constraint (it just repeats what's been stated in Input section).

Thanks.
Thank you for the corrections. It has been done.

The missing test cases added, also stub default output fixed.
thank you!

Thank your for approve.
I made an edit, can you test and approve again?

In any case, the question is very clear for reverse mode, and -1 always means not having an answer to the problem, and I don't think it makes much difference. Maybe it's better to just remove the reverse mode option altogether.

Thanks. One more thing ...

Test case 4 can succeed by checking either diagonal.
There are no test cases specific for top-left to bottom-right diagonal hence you could remove dia1 checks from your code and still pass all test cases ðŸ¤”

Also validator 4 is testing the rows/columns instead of the diagonals like test 4.

Test 4 and Validator 4 checking another thing, The conditions under which the user can win the game in two different ways by placing a mark.
Thank you, I will add a test case for top left to bottom right

Output
* Please add the words "of where the mark should be added".

* Please mention that the indexing of rows and columns is 0-based.

Thanks.
